intro: Calycolpus kegelianus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender calycolpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
